name: MLCOptimizerDescriptor
desc: A configuration object you use to create an optimizer.

items.name: init(learningRate: Float, gradientRescale: Float, regularizationType: MLCRegularizationType, regularizationScale: Float)
items.desc: Creates an optimizer descriptor with the learning rate, gradient rescale, regularization type, and regulation scale that you specify.

items.name: init(learningRate: Float, gradientRescale: Float, appliesGradientClipping: Bool, gradientClipMax: Float, gradientClipMin: Float, regularizationType: MLCRegularizationType, regularizationScale: Float)
items.desc: Creates a descriptor with the learning rate, gradient rescale, clipping option and values, and regularization type and scale that you specify.

items.name: init(learningRate: Float, gradientRescale: Float, appliesGradientClipping: Bool, gradientClippingType: MLCGradientClippingType, gradientClipMax: Float, gradientClipMin: Float, maximumClippingNorm: Float, customGlobalNorm: Float, regularizationType: MLCRegularizationType, regularizationScale: Float)
items.desc: Creates a descriptor with the learning rate, gradient rescale, clipping option and values, and regularization type and scale that you specify.

items.name: var gradientRescale: Float
items.desc: The rescale value the optimizer applies to gradients during updates.

items.name: var appliesGradientClipping: Bool
items.desc: A Boolean that indicates whether you apply gradient clipping.

items.name: var gradientClipMax: Float
items.desc: The maximum gradient value before the optimizer rescales the gradient, if you enabled gradient clipping.

items.name: var gradientClipMin: Float
items.desc: The minimum gradient value before the optimizer rescales the gradient, if you enabled gradient clipping.

items.name: var gradientClippingType: MLCGradientClippingType
items.desc: The type of clipping the system applies to the gradient.

items.name: enum MLCGradientClippingType
items.desc: A clipping type the system applies to a gradient.

items.name: var customGlobalNorm: Float
items.desc: A custom norm the system uses in place of the global norm.
